title: Researching cause of lag on patch 6.7 (4/11/16)
body:
Welcome aboard summoners! This is the thread where everyone and anyone experiencing **lag every few games** are welcome to join me in my research and create awareness so we can get a proper reply/sticky post from Riot. Let's start with me shall we?

Things to note about my journey:
1. I have followed up with Riot support about 3 times. It finally came down to me using WTFast trial. A VPN does seem to fix my lag, but at the cost of increasing my ping by 20 and paying $5-$10 a month for a VPN (That's too much money for me). There are quite a few free VPNs out there, so I highly suggest you do your own research.
2. I have contact my ISP about 5 times. Unfortunately, I can't get past level 1 tech support. Although, I do like the refresh signals they keep sending out to me. Every time I contact them, they say, "Oh, it seems your signals are configured improperly. Let me fix that for you!" The same exact _solution_ from them 5 times in a row. Interesting right?
3. Yes, I am aware there are multiple devices connected to my router. Actually, 8 devices in total. All under a 56mbps download and 5mpbs upload speed. **HOWEVER,** I have turned off the wifi-function on my router and made it so I am the **ONLY** device utilizing the Internet. I still managed to pull a win in a normal game with 300ms-1.200ms (lol XinZhao).

So, I have decided to take it upon myself to fix the issue. And by myself, I mean **BRING TOGETHER EVERYONE WHO IS SUFFERING :(**

I play League on a consistent 30ms. Or, at least I _used_ to. Ever since patch 6.6, I've been having very unusual lag issues. Fortunately, I've located the part of the issue.

From the 10 minutes of googling that I've done, if my sources are correct (http://www.inmotionhosting.com/support/website/how-to/read-traceroute)
tldr: 
1. Each IP address after the first is a relay node. Usually the first node is your home IP address, then the ISP, then nodes all over NA, then the last 2 nodes are Riot-based nodes.
2. High or fluctuating ping on the first few nodes _after the first_ are the cause of my ISP.
3. High or fluctuating ping on the middle-tier nodes are... unknown (help me here)
4. High or fluctuating ping on the last few nodes are Riot-based nodes, as the last node is the IP address of the LoL servers stationed in Chicago.

**In conclusion**, based on my tracert report, it seems that both my ISP and Riot are having node issues. **Also, a gaming-based VPN is a current workaround**. What confuses me is that the lag we are all experiencing is _random_. As if, some games don't even use the nodes shown in my traceroute. It's very interesting. ~~And by interesting, I mean painful to watch an Annie slaughter you to death without you being able to react even if you had a Quicksilver Sash because it requires fast reaction times + low ping to make use of it efficiently.~~

How to fix? Idk. Let's make noise and hope someone replies.

replies.body: This new patch is giving me huge lag issues in Pennsylvania ðŸ˜•

Hihihihi! I started using the free trial of WTFast yesterday and it completely changed my ping back to prev-6.7 patch numbers. I'm from the UK I play on the NA servers, before the patch I played on 95-105, now I play on 155-165 but with WTFast I'm back down to 101 which is extremely frickin helpful. I'm actually happy a Riot member decided to reply for once instead of ignoring all of our pleas, and we can get some insight into why our ping has changed over the last week or so, from what I gather here your ping is spiking in and around Riot's servers? So does that mean it's less likely to be our ISP and more Riot or what? {{champion:55}}

EDIT: Just read the conclusion again,  my mind seemed to not want to take in information, you're having lags both near your ISP and Riot Direct. D:

The more I think about it, the less I believe patch 6.7 affect our networks at all. Since when did patching game files reroute our connections in the first place? It might just be a coincidence.

I'm slightly happy you found a temporary work-around, but we must continue researching for a permanent solution.

actually, it's more than likely a coding error.  There does not have to be a fatal error for there to be significant repercussions.  An infinite loop, for one, could drag a game to its knees for anyone without a connection fast enough to beat the loop if it is somehow causing actions to be resent to the server

overall though, I think that somehow riot has changed the number of players that the server can handle and it is dropping entire groups of players at a time

I'm from the UK I play on the NA servers, before the patch I played on 95-105, now I play on 155-165 but with WTFast I'm back down to 101 which is extremely frickin helpful. So does that mean it's less likely to be our ISP and more Riot or what? {{champion:55}}
> 
> EDIT: Just read the conclusion again,  my mind seemed to not want to take in information, you're having lags both near your ISP and Riot Direct. D:

Hey, I'm also playing from Europe, Central Europe to be exact, before the patch, my ping was ~140, now it's 200. I have checked several places (home, dorm; so different providers) and the increase is about the same in both. So I imagine there's some routing issue? A fish ate an undersea cable? Although I asked my Portuguese friend and he doesn't seem to have any issues.

Heyo,

The reason your ping will change if you F4 enough times is mostly like routing changes.

Internet connections usually go like so (if we assume your ISP doesn't contain the entire route to where you're going):

Home
Neighborhood routing node (usually within a few hundred feet/fourth of a mile)
Primary hop onto your ISPs network
Your ISP network
3rd Party Contracted ISP (to fill in blanks/coverage)
Node directly near resource
Resource

If you can F4 multiple times and find a different routing path, probably means there's network load balancing issues. If a specific node is reaching a general traffic load limit, the system will route incoming data to a new path in order to reduce future load on that specific node to allow it to fall back down to normal traffic levels. 

As for why our nodes near Riot Direct are so high is odd, pretty sure network engineers are on it if there's a problem. I'll ping to make sure it's not flying under our radar. 

Lastly, VPNs! VPNs change a lot of that route. Basically from your neighborhood routing node to the node directly near resource can be completely different. It's why testing for packet loss or general inability to connect has testing a VPN as a good step. 

Hopefully this provides a little more light on it!

Yeah but since the last patch i have 120 ping, and speedtest says i have 19, and the other games i play say i have between 20-25, so whats wrong with the servers
There still constant lag spikes :/ whats with this patch... ever since 6.14

Hey guys, it's  4-24-2016 (april 24th, 2016) and i'm having the same issue. 

Ping says "32 ms" which is GREAT on my terms, BUT.....

About once every 15 seconds or so, all the champion spells will stop showing. I'll still see people moving around sometimes, but then about 5 seconds later, all the missing spells and animations will CRASH INSTANTLY as if it were some sick and twisted, lag-inflated tristana bomb.

Do the math on that real quick, once every 15 seconds, I lose about 5 seconds of the game. so that's like saying in an average 30 minute game, I AM INCOMPETANT FOR AN AVERAGE OF 10 MINUTES.


This terrible nightmare happened to me around patch 6.1, but now we're at it again with the white vans Daniel and its 6.8

I pay for the highest internet connection from timewarner possible,
I'm connectd via Ethernet cable DIRECTLY
Asus I5 laptop (not the best but its 1 year old and should run shit JUST fine)

two words, Rito pls.

I'm in the exact same situation, I didnt have any problems until about a month or two ago. I dont think its on my end because I didnt change my internet or anything like that. Its also very inconsistent, some games I dont lag out at all and other games I cant 2 minutes without some delay. Its super frustrating and Ive tried everything I can think of.

my pings been spiking into the high thousands normally i have a steady 70 or so. i literately had to leave my current ranked game because the server is fking the shit out of me. but ive won a few games even with this lagg going on during the game. 

ill go from somewhere around 130 at the start of the match (thats when i know im gonna have a laggy game)
straight to 600 , then sometime around first blood, (which im not the victim) lagg will go up to 1300 very commonly
and even more commonly 6300 then when im about to turn the game off i notice im around 8000
it varies back and forth from the high hundreds to the low hundreds which is very misleading and im sure ill be reported many more times, 

i gotta say from playing since season 1 and all the horrible changes ive seen to this game, (i think the balance is perfect and i dont main garbage champs)
this lagg shit might be what makes me quit for good,

anyone else's ping got fixed?
as of today im not experiencing any abnormal game ping.
i tried making custom game 10 times, and usually within 3rd custom game, i would experience a stable 90-100 ping (which is abnormal for me).
However, all 10 custom made games connected with 30s ping as I would normally in season 5.

APRIL 13TH, 2016
Ranked queues were down for a 5am Network...patch..thing.

I'm guessing they addressed the issue from their side. Now I have to deal with my ISP.

for temporary solution, you can alt f4 several times in game until a better ip address is found by the client.
its just pathetic that i have to do this to get a reliable gaming experience

yeah but if you alt f4 more then 5 times in a game they will ban your account for a few days for leaving/re connectiong, i have had them literally tell me the system cannont tell the difference from a disconnect or a leaver

usually it works within 3rd try for me.
and if it doesnt work after my 3rd try, i just play for a bit because either way the minions are gonna spawn and i dont wanna miss the initial exp to level 2. 
after my first recall to buy items, etc, i try to alt f4 again.
i think the most times i've alt f4 in a game was 4 or 5 times.. cant remember.. but it usually should work at 50% chance and not go over 5th try.
AND as of today, the problem is fixed for me for some reason.
it had been fixed even before the scheduled network maintenance. 
I had an ongoing ticket addressing this issue and riot had been working along.
currently just waiting for their reply to how the problem got fixed.
Another work-around provided by a fellow summoner! 10/10

CoolNoob, thanks for the research. You are helping the community:)
I think all that you've said, its true. As i did the same tests, and the resiults are practically identical.
horray
